misuses.misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
misuses.description: The method 'method1' uses a null byte array as the salt for the password-based encryption algorithm. This can lead to a weak encryption and make the password more vulnerable to brute force attacks.
misuses.recommendation: Use a strong and unique salt for each password encryption.

misuses.misuse: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
misuses.description: The class 'C1' uses a fixed salt value for all instances. This can make the encryption predictable and easier to crack.
misuses.recommendation: Use a unique and random salt value for each instance.
